articles.title: Great Barrier Reef has lost 50 per cent of its coral populations in the past 30 years - 7NEWS.com.au
articles.description: A new study on the famous reef's coral population has sounded a fresh alarm on the devastating impact of climate change.
articles.content:
The Great Barrier Reef has lost 50 per cent of its coral populations in the last three decades, with climate change a key driver of reef disturbance, a new study has found.
